TextENG: ``...Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha.``

TextJPN: これほど爽やかでない笑い声は聞いたことがなかった。
TextENG: I had never heard such an unpleasant laugh before.

TextJPN: …それはまさに…連続する呼吸音。
TextENG: ...It had become... akin to the sound of her breathing.

TextJPN: すでに声や感情表現ですらない。
TextENG: It was no longer a voice or an expression of feeling.

TextJPN: 「………大丈夫だよ。@k@vS01/02/120200448.レナが助けてあげるから」
TextENG: ``...Don't worry.@k@vS01/02/120200448. I'll save you.``

TextJPN: レナは@bなた.@<鉈@>を大きく振り上げたまま……さらに一歩踏み込んでくる。
TextENG: Rena took one step forward... still holding the hatchet high above her head.
``...Now then...``

TextJPN: さらに一歩。レナの顔が俺の眼前いっぱいに広がる。
TextENG: One step closer. Rena's face spread out to fill my vision.

TextJPN: さらに一歩。
TextENG: One step closer.

TextJPN: レナの鼻が俺の鼻にかするぐらい…間近に迫る。
TextENG: Rena's nose was close enough to touch mine... and was still pushing closer.

TextJPN: 「………話したいことがあるんだよね？　………レナが聞いてあげる。@k@vS01/02/120200452.助けてあげるから………ね？@k@vS01/02/120200453.　話してね？@k@vS01/02/120200454.　話してね？」
TextENG: ``...There's something you want to say, isn't there? ...I'll listen.@k@vS01/02/120200452. I'll save you... okay?@k@vS01/02/120200453. Speak, okay?@k@vS01/02/120200454. Speak, okay?``

TextJPN: 俺はぺたんとしりもちをついてへたり込む。
TextENG: I slumped down, landing squarely on my butt.

TextJPN: ……それは情けないことじゃない。
TextENG: ...It wasn't for some pathetic reason.

TextJPN: …少しでもレナから離れるための、精一杯の逃げだった…。
TextENG: ...It was all I could do to get as far away from Rena...

TextJPN: 「あはははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははは……、」
TextENG: ``Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha...``

TextJPN: その笑いを終わらせてはならないと直感する。
TextENG: I had the gut feeling that I couldn't let her laughter end.

TextJPN: …その笑いが終わった時、……！！
TextENG: ...Because when that laughing ended...!!

TextJPN: それを感じ取った瞬間に体が反射的に動いた。
TextENG: The moment I picked up on that feeling, my body moved by instinct.

TextJPN: 自分でも信じられないくらいの素早さで跳ぶように起き上がり、レナを両手で弾き飛ばす！
TextENG: I sprang to my feet so fast even I couldn't believe it, and pushed Rena away with both hands!

TextJPN: レナはまるで羽で出来ているかのような軽さだった。
TextENG: Rena was as light as a feather.

TextJPN: 不釣合いな@bなた.@<鉈@>の重さに大きく振られ、まるで風に乗るかのように軽々と飛ばされる。
TextENG: Thrown about by the unbalanced weight of the hatchet, she was sent backwards as if she had been carried off by the wind.

TextJPN: それを視界の隅に確認すると、あとは一目散だった。
TextENG: After confirming that out of the corner of my eye, I dashed off at full speed.

TextJPN: 脱兎のごとくという言葉がこれ以上似合うことはないだろう。
TextENG: I was the perfect picture of ``fleeing like a greased pig.``

TextJPN: …レナから離れよう。
TextENG: ...Get away from Rena.

TextJPN: 逃げよう。
TextENG: Run away.

TextJPN: 生き延びよう！！！
TextENG: Survive!!!

TextJPN: それ以上のことは何も思いつかなかった。
TextENG: I couldn't think of anything other than this.

TextJPN: 走りながら、俺はずっとバットを握り締めていたことを思い出す。
TextENG: While I was running, I remembered I'd been holding onto a bat the entire time.

TextJPN: ……なんて役に立たない武器なんだ。
TextENG: ...Such a worthless weapon.

TextJPN: …肝心な時に武器であることすら忘れているとは…！！
TextENG: ...I couldn't believe I'd forgotten about this weapon at such an important time...!

TextJPN: 曲がりくねった道をさらにさらに駆け抜ける！！
TextENG: I sped even farther down the winding path!!

TextJPN: 息苦しさも足の重さも一切感じなかった。
TextENG: I didn't even feel myself gasping for breath or my legs getting heavy.

TextJPN: …俺の体も理解しているのだ。@k…ここで走らなかったら…命がないことにッ！！
TextENG: ...My body understood it as well.@k If I didn't run away from here... I wouldn't live!!

TextJPN: 後ろからあの、あはははははは…という笑い声を模したレナの威嚇が聞こえてくる。
TextENG: I could hear the laughter of that simulacrum of Rena coming from behind me.

TextJPN: それは木々と俺の頭の中にこだまし、少しでも俺の正気を失わせようと作用していた。
TextENG: It rang through the trees and in my head, and slowly chiseled away at my sanity.

TextJPN: 木立がまばらになり視界が一気に開ける。
TextENG: The grove of trees thinned out, my field of vision suddenly expanding.

TextJPN: ここは…？！
TextENG: Where was this...!?

TextJPN: 知っていそうで覚えのない光景に一瞬混乱する…。
TextENG: For a moment, I was bewildered by the scenery I felt I knew but couldn't quite remember...

TextJPN: すぐに気付く。
TextENG: I quickly realized...

TextJPN: ダム現場だった。
TextENG: It was the dam site.

TextJPN: あんなにめちゃくちゃに疾走して、このような場所にたどり着くこと自体、何だか誰かの筋書きに従わされているような薄気味悪さがあった。
TextENG: The fact that I'd dashed madly and ended up in a place like this gave me a bad feeling, like I was following someone's scripted plot.

TextJPN: 見通しはいいが、ひと気のまったくないところだ。
TextENG: I had a good view of my surroundings, but I didn't see a single soul here.

TextJPN: 逃げる者にはあまりに辛く、襲う者にとってはこれほど都合のいい場所もない。
TextENG: This was a terrible spot for someone on the run, but there was no better place for an attacker.

TextJPN: 心臓はすでに爆発寸前だった。
TextENG: My heart was already on the verge of bursting.

TextJPN: 足の筋肉も悲鳴を上げている。@kだが構わなかった。
TextENG: The muscles in my legs were screaming.@k But I didn't care.

TextJPN: ここで休んだら、もう悲鳴を上げることさえできなくなってしまうかも知れないのだから。
TextENG: If I stopped here, then they might not even be able to scream for much longer.

TextJPN: それでも、一休みする口実が欲しくて後ろを振り返った。@k………レナの姿はない。
TextENG: Even still, I glanced back, looking for an excuse to rest.@k Rena wasn't there...

TextJPN: かわりに、村人が２人ほど歩いてくるのが見えた。
TextENG: Instead, I saw two villagers walking around.

TextJPN: レナでなく、かつ、第三者が登場したことに、ほっと胸を撫で下ろそうとする…。
TextENG: I breathed a sigh of relief that it wasn't Rena, but a third party...

TextJPN: だが、俺の中のもうひとりの俺が再び警鐘を鳴らす…。
TextENG: Except the voice inside me rang the alarm once again...

TextJPN: 村人が歩いていることに不審はない。だが、気になった。
TextENG: Villagers walking around weren't suspicious in and of themselves. But it bothered me.

TextJPN: 服装は２人ともラフ。@k手ぶらで、いかにも散歩のような感じ……。
TextENG: They both wore rough-looking clothes.@k Empty-handed, they definitely gave the impression that they were just out for a walk...

TextJPN: だが……時間帯と、大人が２人して意味もなく、というところに何か不審な印象を受けなくもなかった。
TextENG: But... At this time of day, two adults wandering around without a purpose. It was enough to raise questions.

TextJPN: ……それよりも……目だった。
TextENG: ...But more than anything else... those eyes...

TextJPN: ２人で談笑しながら散歩…ではなく、２人とも押し黙り、…まっすぐ…こっちを見据えて歩いてくるのだ。
TextENG: They weren't chit-chatting while walking. They were both silent... heading forward... looking in my direction.

TextJPN: 神経が高ぶっていて、ついついそう見えてしまうのか…？！
TextENG: Was I at the end of my rope and had finally started imagining things...!?

TextJPN: ……走って逃げよう。
TextENG: ...I should run away.

TextJPN: 多分最善の選択だ。
TextENG: That was probably the best choice.

TextJPN: 無関係な人間なら、走れば簡単に振り切れる。
TextENG: If they weren't involved, I'd lose them easily by running.

TextJPN: ……もしも俺を狙う連中なら…同じように走って追って来るはず。
TextENG: ...If they were part of the group after me... then they would come running after me.

TextJPN: どちらにせよ、もたもたしていればレナが追いつく。
TextENG: Either way, unless I hurried up, Rena would catch up with me.

TextJPN: そうだ……走ろうッ！！！
TextENG: That's right... I was going to run!!!

TextJPN: そう思い、踵を返そうとした瞬間、そんな俺の考えを見透かしたかのように…その２人が駆け出した！！
TextENG: Deciding that, the moment I began to turn tail... both of them rushed towards me, as if they knew exactly what I was thinking!!

TextJPN: 俺は心のどこかでレナに怯えながらも、怖いのはレナひとりだと決め付けてきた。
TextENG: Somewhere inside me, I had jumped to the conclusion that Rena was the only thing I needed to be afraid of.

TextJPN: レナだけが怖いから、それ以外は怖くないと…そう思い込もうとしてきた。
TextENG: I made the assumption that I didn't need fear anything else...

TextJPN: だが……今こうして赤裸々に…これ以上ないくらい明白な形で思い知らされる！！
TextENG: But right now... I realized just how blatantly wrong I was!

TextJPN: …鬼たちは村総出で獲物を追い回した、という大石さんに聞かされた鬼ヶ淵の昔話がふっと脳裏をよぎった………。
TextENG: Suddenly, the story Ooishi-san told me about the demons all leaving the village to hunt prey floated through the back of my mind.

TextJPN: 後ろを振り返らないでも、２人が俺に追いついてくるのが、その荒々しい足音でよくわかった。
TextENG: I could tell they were both coming after me without even turning around because of their frenetic footsteps.

TextJPN: レナのように、振り切れず追いつかれずの間合いで、真綿で締められるように追われるのも恐ろしかったが…、そんなのは比にならない。
TextENG: It was frightening, being unable to shake Rena off as she slowly closed in on me... but this didn't even compare.

TextJPN: あまりにも暴力的に迫る、この直接的恐怖に勝るものなどあるわけもない…ッ！！！
TextENG: Being pursued with such violent ferocity... this straightforward horror was unparalleled...!!!

TextJPN: 追跡者の腕が、一度肩をかすった。
TextENG: One of the pursuers' arms grazed my shoulder.

TextJPN: …荒々しい足音だけでなく、すでにその呼吸音まではっきりと聞こえる。
TextENG: ...Now it wasn't just their frenzied footsteps, but also the distinct sound of their breathing that I could hear.

TextJPN: …いや、…その吐息をうなじに直接感じるくらいに！！　俺のすぐ後ろまで迫ってきている…ッ！！！！
TextENG: ...No... I could practically feel them breathing on me! They were already right behind me...!

TextJPN: …クールになれ前原圭一。
TextENG: ...Calm down, Keiichi Maebara.

TextJPN: 俺は全力疾走のまま、空中に静止するかのような……、いや、時間が静止するかのような感覚を味わっていた。
TextENG: Still running at full tilt, I felt the surrounding area go still... No, it felt like time itself had stopped.

TextJPN: その全てが凍りついた世界で…俺は少しだけ後ろを振り返り…追跡者がいかに俺の間近に迫っているかを改めて知った。
TextENG: I turned my head back slightly in that frozen world... realizing how close my pursuers had gotten to me.

TextJPN: …大人の足には勝てない。
TextENG: ...I couldn't win against the legs of an adult.

TextJPN: 凍った時間が溶け出せば、まばたきをふたつもしない内に…俺は組み伏せられるだろう。
TextENG: In less than the time it would take to blink twice, when this frozen time began moving again... they'd be right on top of me.

TextJPN: 組み伏せられて……それから…？
TextENG: On top of me... and then...?

TextJPN: 考えるな圭一。
TextENG: Don't think about that, Keiichi.

TextJPN: …このままでは振り切れないことをまず認識しろ。
TextENG: ...First, realize that you won't be able to shake them off like this.

TextJPN: 逃げ切れないことが確定したなら…あとは俺が決断するだけでいい…。
TextENG: If the fact that you can't get away was a given, then you need to make a decision...

TextJPN: 次の右足でそれをやるか、それとも左足でやるか…決めるだけでいい。
TextENG: Go with the right leg or go with the left... you just need to decide which one.

TextJPN: …左足で行こう。
TextENG: Let's go with the left...

TextJPN: そう決心した瞬間、凍った時間が木っ端微塵に砕け散るッ！！！
TextENG: The moment I decided that... the temporal singularity burst into pieces!!
Right, left!!!

TextJPN: 右腕のバットを大きく振り、その遠心力を使って、急停止、急旋回。
TextENG: I swung the bat in a wide arc with my right arm, using that inertia, I stopped and suddenly spun.

TextJPN: ２人は明らかに驚いた。
TextENG: The two of them were clearly startled.

TextJPN: …俺の姿を瞬間的に見失い、俺を組み伏せようとして繰り出した両の手が空を切る！
TextENG: ...Momentarily losing sight of me, both of their outstretched arms—ready to grab me—instead grasped at empty space!

TextJPN: 右の男が（よく気付けたと賞賛するべきだ）後方に振り返り、いるはずがない場所に立つ俺と目が合い、驚愕した。@k…だがもう遅いッ！！！！
TextENG: The man on the right (I applaud him being able to figure it out) spun around to the spot I shouldn't have been, and faced me in astonishment.@k But it was too late!!!!

TextJPN: 俺はバットを振る必要もなかった。
TextENG: I didn't even need to swing my bat.

TextJPN: ただ、遠心力のままにその軌道を延長するだけでいい！！
TextENG: All I needed to do was extend my arms as I turned around.

TextJPN: 軽い当たりだったが、バランスを崩させ転倒させるだけの威力はあったようだ。
TextENG: It was by no means a heavy blow, but it seemed like it had enough power behind it to knock him off his feet.

TextJPN: だが転倒したくらいで怯むことはなかった。
TextENG: But just knocking him down wasn't enough to scare him away.

TextJPN: すぐに起き上がってくる！
TextENG: He got back up in no time!

TextJPN: ２人はすぐに俺に振り返ると身構え、対峙した。
TextENG: Both of them took a fighting stance and were ready to face me.

TextJPN: これにより、単なる散歩の二人連れでなく、俺を対象にした追跡者であることが確認される！！
TextENG: This made me certain they weren't just two people out for a walk—they were clearly after me!

TextJPN: レナよりも気楽だった。
TextENG: It felt much easier than dealing with Rena.

TextJPN: 顔も知らない村人が、知らないがゆえにこれだけ気楽だとは…夢にも思わなかった。@k…心の中で苦笑する。
TextENG: Just by not recognizing their faces, by not knowing them—it made things easier.@k I smiled wryly on the inside.

TextJPN: 「俺に何か用かよッ？！？！@k@vS01/01/120100767.　次は眉間にお見舞いするぞこの野郎ッ！！！！」
TextENG: ``What do you want with me!?@k@vS01/01/120100767. Next one is going to be right in your face, you bastard!``

TextJPN: 強がりでもいい！
TextENG: It's fine if it was just a bluff!

TextJPN: 吠えることにより、自らの内に眠る起爆力を呼び覚ます。
TextENG: By barking out at them, I was able to fire myself up.

TextJPN: 男たちはそれに応えたりはしなかった。
TextENG: They didn't respond.

TextJPN: 信じられないくらい、冷静な表情で俺の左右に散った。
TextENG: They spread out to either side of me with unbelievably calm expressions on their faces.

TextJPN: １人はバットに組み付き、もう１人は俺を組み伏せる、そういう算段か。@k…１対２では…どうにもならない！！
TextENG: One of them would grab onto my bat and the other would hold me down... was that their plan?@k Taking on both of them at once... would be impossible!!

TextJPN: 体中から熱い汗がどっと吹き出る。
TextENG: Hot sweat poured from every pore in my body.

TextJPN: ならば先手必勝だ！！
TextENG: Then I'd just have to settle it with the first move!!

TextJPN: 先に踏み込み、１人を打ち崩すッ！！！
TextENG: I'd step in and strike the first one down!!!

TextJPN: 先に先制攻撃を加えた右の男に的を絞り、渾身の踏み込みによる強打を振り上げる。
TextENG: Narrowing my target down to the man on the right who had already been knocked down before, I stepped in and swung with all my might.

TextJPN: 素手の人間にとって、どのような防ぎ方をしても…致命的なダメージになる！！
TextENG: There was no way for an unarmed person to guard against it... it would cause immense damage!!

TextJPN: 腕で防げば骨ごとへし折り、背中でかばえば内臓の奥にまでダメージを送り込むことが可能！！
TextENG: If they blocked it with their arm, their bone would snap like a twig; if they turned their back to it, then it was possible that the blow would travel all the way to their vital organs!

TextJPN: 相手もそれを理解しているようだった。
TextENG: It looked like he was aware of this.

TextJPN: 俺の必殺の間合いのさらに内側に飛び込み、その拳で俺の腹部を狙う！！！
TextENG: He pushed farther through the kill zone between us and delivered a fist right into my gut!!!

TextJPN: まずい…、この間合い、この姿勢、この状態では…回避する術は何もない！！
TextENG: Not good... with this distance, in this position and in this state... there was no way for me to dodge it!!

TextJPN: 世界がでんぐり返り、自分の体がまるで木の葉のように…軽々と吹っ飛んでいくのがわかった。
TextENG: The world flipped upside-down... I understood that I was being tossed around like a rag doll.

TextJPN: 音もなく、柔らかに地面に打ち付けられ、顔面でがりがりとした砂利の感触を味わう。
TextENG: I landed on the soft earth without a sound, feeling the grainy soil press against my face.

TextJPN: …痛みはなかった。
TextENG: ...It didn't hurt at all.

TextJPN: ……と思ったのもつかの間、すぐに皮膚が擦り剥けるあの嫌な痛みと、胃の内容物がこみ上げてくる時にする、あの苦い感覚が口中を満たす。
TextENG: ...But the moment I thought that, I suddenly felt pain coming from the abrasions on my skin, as well as the contents of my stomach being forced upwards, flooding my mouth with a bitter sensation.

TextJPN: そんな痛みを堪能する時間もないことを、今の俺はよく理解していた。
TextENG: I knew very well that I didn't have the time to relish this experience.

TextJPN: すぐに立ち上がるが、その時にはすでに次の男が眼前に迫ってきていた。
TextENG: I stood up as quickly as I could. But at that moment, the other man was already barreling towards me.

TextJPN: …回避できないことを冷静に理解できることが、かえって悔しい。
TextENG: ...Being able to comprehend calmly that I simply couldn't dodge it made it all the more upsetting.

TextJPN: もう一度、腹に渾身の一撃を入れると、そいつはぐるっと俺の背後にまわり、ぶっとい腕で俺の首をがっちりとロックする！！
TextENG: After plowing into my stomach full-force once again, my assailant twisted around behind me and locked his thick arm around my neck!!

TextJPN: …凄まじい腕力に、喉がつぶされるッ！！
TextENG: ...My throat felt like it was being crushed by his immense strength!!

TextJPN: 窒息するとか昏倒するとか、そんな理屈は思いつかなかった。
TextENG: I couldn't even contemplate that I was being strangled, or that I was about to go unconscious.

TextJPN: …ただ、視界が真っ暗になり、頭の奥でじーーんという音が聞こえるだけ。
TextENG: ...My vision simply darkened and a silent whining noise began playing deep inside my mind.

TextJPN: 意識を途切れないように保つのだけが精一杯だった。
TextENG: It took everything I had to keep myself from blacking out.

TextJPN: こうしてもがいてる間にも、もう一人の男は無防備になった俺の真正面に立っているに違いない。
TextENG: While this was happening, the other man was more than likely standing in front of me.

TextJPN: 目を開けることはできなかったが、気配でそれを感じることができる。
TextENG: I wasn't able to open my eyes, but I could feel that he was there.

TextJPN: 俺になす術はない。
TextENG: There was nothing I could do now.

TextJPN: 腕も振り解けず、逃げることも反撃することもできない。
TextENG: Unable to shake this arm off me, I couldn't run. I couldn't fight back.

TextJPN: 絶体絶命…という複雑な単語は、もう思いつかなかった……………………。
TextENG: Dire straits,' I couldn't even come up with the phrase that adequately described my situation...

TextJPN: 見慣れた天井だった。
TextENG: A familiar ceiling.

TextJPN: …まくらや布団のにおいも…とても馴染んだもの。
TextENG: ...The smell of the bed and pillows... I knew them well.

TextJPN: ……ここは……俺の部屋だ？
TextENG: ...Was this... my room?

TextJPN: 普段なら俺以外がいることもないはずの室内に、俺以外の気配を感じたので、ばっと飛び起きた！@k　……その途端、全身に痛みが走った。
TextENG: Normally there wouldn't be anyone in my room besides me, but their presence made me spring wide awake!@k ...When I did that... pain shot throughout my entire body.

TextJPN: 「……大丈夫かな？@k@vS01/02/120200457.　横になってた方がいいと思うよ…」
TextENG: ``...Feeling all right?@k@vS01/02/120200457. I think you'd better just lie down for a bit...``

TextJPN: なぜ俺がここにいてレナがここにいる？！@k　全身の血管と筋肉が収縮する！！！
TextENG: Why was Rena in my room!?@k Blood began to surge through my muscles and my capillaries!

TextJPN: ………だが…レナの微笑みは俺のよく知るレナのものだった。
TextENG: ...But... Rena's smile belonged to the Rena I knew well.

TextJPN: …気を許してはいけない…と知りつつも、今のレナは大丈夫だ、と勝手に安心してしまう…。
TextENG: ...I knew I shouldn't let myself feel this way... but I relaxed thinking that this version of Rena was safe...

TextJPN: 「………俺は……どうして……」
「…覚えてないの？」
TextENG: ``...Don't you remember?``

TextJPN: 「………意識がなくなってからのことは……全然………」
TextENG: ``...After losing consciousness... nothing at all...``

TextJPN: 体は俺が想像する以上に鈍重になっていた。
TextENG: My body had become more lethargic than I could ever have imagined.

TextJPN: …あの一瞬で俺自身の持つ限界を出し切ったのだから、ガタが来ても当然かもしれない…。
TextENG: ...I guess that would be the expected outcome after exerting everything I had back there...

TextJPN: せめて意識だけでも鮮明にしようと足掻くが、…頭の中にもやがかかったような鈍さはなかなか抜けなかった。
TextENG: I tried to at least clear my head... but I just couldn't shake the sluggish feeling out of my mind.

TextJPN: 「一応、お医者さんにも電話したから。@k@vS01/02/120200460.もうすぐ来ると思うよ。@k@vS01/02/120200461.…それまで横になってた方がいいと思うな」
TextENG: ``I called the doctor...@k@vS01/02/120200460. He should be here soon.@k@vS01/02/120200461. I think you'd better just lie down until then.``

TextJPN: 医者を呼ばれるほど大袈裟な怪我じゃない。
TextENG: I wasn't injured seriously enough to merit calling a doctor.

TextJPN: ……だが医者という公正な立場の人間に来てもらえるのは少し心強い…。
TextENG: ...But knowing that someone impartial was coming was slightly reassuring...

TextJPN: 「……俺、どうしてここにいるんだ…？@k@vS01/01/120100771.　確か…ダム現場で……」
TextENG: ``...Why... am I here...?@k@vS01/01/120100771. I'm sure... I was at the dam site...``

TextJPN: 「それはレナが聞きたいな。@k@vS01/02/120200463.…何があったのかな？@k@vS01/02/120200464.　レナが行った時には圭一くん、倒れてて……」
TextENG: ``That's what I want to know.@k@vS01/02/120200463. ...What happened?@k@vS01/02/120200464. When I got there, Keiichi-kun was already passed out...``

TextJPN: 「…だから聞きたいのは俺の方だよ。@k@vS01/01/120100773.…変な二人組に襲われて……」
TextENG: ``...That's why I'm the one who wants to know...@k@vS01/01/120100773. I was attacked by two weirdos...``

TextJPN: 口に出し、ようやく意識を失う直前の記憶が蘇ってくる。
TextENG: As I talked about it, I finally remembered what happened right before I passed out.

TextJPN: その記憶が、恐怖として蘇るにつれ、頭の中のもやも少しずつ晴れていった。
TextENG: Recalling that memory and the terror that went along with it caused the fogginess around my head to clear right up.

TextJPN: あの２人のことはともかく。
TextENG: Let's forget about those two for now.

TextJPN: …レナが俺を介抱してくれたのが…意外だった。
TextENG: ...I didn't expect... Rena to be nursing me.

TextJPN: 俺はレナに命を狙われていると思っていた。
TextENG: I thought Rena was trying to kill me.

TextJPN: …なら、意識を失っていたときは最高のチャンスだったはずだ。
TextENG: She would have had the perfect chance while I was unconscious.

TextJPN: にもかかわらず、俺は殺されず、どころかこうして介抱されている。
TextENG: Not only did she not kill me, she had nursed me back to health.

TextJPN: 「……よく、俺を引きずってここまでこれたな。@k@vS01/01/120100775.…重かったろ」
TextENG: ``...Amazing you could drag me all the way back here.@k@vS01/01/120100775. ...Wasn't I heavy?``

TextJPN: レナの華奢な体つきを見れば、俺を自宅の、それも二階まで引きずってきたのは尋常じゃない。
TextENG: Looking at Rena's delicate frame, it was hard to believe that she had not only gotten me back home, but even dragged me all the way up to the second floor.

TextJPN: ………他に仲間がいるのか…？
TextENG: ...Did she have some help...?

TextJPN: 「………圭一くん、覚えてないの？」
TextENG: ``...Don't you remember, Keiichi-kun?``

TextJPN: レナはきょとんとしながらも笑顔でこたえる。
TextENG: Rena appeared a bit surprised, but still kept her smile.

TextJPN: 「…レナは圭一くんに肩を貸しただけだよ？@k@vS01/02/120200467.　大丈夫、自分で歩けるって圭一くんが………。@k@vS01/02/120200468.………覚えてない？」
TextENG: ``...I only propped you up on my shoulder.@k@vS01/02/120200467. You said you could walk on your own and that you were fine...@k@vS01/02/120200468. You don't remember?``

TextJPN: …覚えていない。
TextENG: ...I didn't remember.

TextJPN: 意識が途切れた後の記憶は不鮮明だ。
TextENG: My memory was fuzzy after the point where I lost consciousness.

TextJPN: 「……二人組はどうした？」
TextENG: ``...What about those two?``

TextJPN: 「……レナが来た時、俺と一緒に…あるいは側に、二人組の男が…、」
TextENG: ``...When you got there, Rena... the ones with me, or rather, those two guys...``

TextJPN: 「いなかったよ」
TextENG: ``There wasn't anyone.``

TextJPN: ぴしゃりと言い切られた。
TextENG: She said it bluntly.

TextJPN: その言い切り方はどこか不快な色があった。
TextENG: The way she stated it felt slightly unpleasant.

TextJPN: この時の俺はあまりに弱気だった…。
TextENG: I was just too timid at that time...

TextJPN: ……レナに詰め寄ることもできたかもしれない。
TextENG: I might have been able to force some answers out of Rena.

TextJPN: だが、そうするときっと…、やさしいレナは、俺の知らない怖いレナに変わってしまうかもしれない…。
TextENG: But if I did that... then this kind Rena might transform into the scary Rena who I didn't know...

TextJPN: それが怖くて……それ以上踏み込むことを避けた。
TextENG: Fearing that... I didn't press any further.

TextJPN: 考えてみれば…当然だ。
TextENG: Thinking about it... it was the obvious choice.

TextJPN: …もしもあの二人がいたら、いくらレナでもかなわないだろう。
TextENG: ...If both of those men were there, I don't think Rena would even have stood a chance.

TextJPN: …俺を連れて行くにはあの二人がいなかったと考えないと説明できない。
TextENG: I couldn't find a way to explain it unless I assumed she brought me here after those two were already gone.

TextJPN: レナは笑顔のままだった。
TextENG: Rena was still smiling.

TextJPN: 瞳の輝きも暖かだった。
TextENG: Her eyes sparkled warmly.

TextJPN: ……なのに……顔の影が少しずつ暗くなっていくような…奇妙な錯覚を感じる…。
TextENG: ...Yet... I felt like I was hallucinating when I saw something... something akin to a shadow slowly creeping across her face...

TextJPN: …そのわずかな予兆に…背筋がぞくりとした……。
TextENG: ...That small omen... sent shivers down my spine...

TextJPN: まだレナがレナでいる内に………連絡しなければ。
TextENG: While Rena was still Rena... I needed to make contact.

TextJPN: ……大石さんに連絡しなければ。
TextENG: ...I needed to contact Ooishi-san.

TextJPN: 俺が寝床を抜け出そうとすると、レナがそれを制した。
TextENG: Rena stopped me when I tried to get out of bed.

TextJPN: 傷に障るから寝ていろ、と言う。
TextENG: She said it would aggravate my wounds, so I should sleep.

TextJPN: 「………トイレに行きたいんだけどな」
TextENG: ``...I'd like to go to the bathroom, though.``

TextJPN: 「…あ、……ごご、…ごめん」
それ以上はレナも何も言わなかった。
TextENG: Rena couldn't say anything else.

TextJPN: レナを部屋に残し、足早に階下へ下りて居間の電話機を目指す。
TextENG: While Rena stayed in the room, I quickly went downstairs to get the phone receiver in the living room.

TextJPN: 玄関の前にさしかかったとき、ピンポーンというチャイムの音がなった。
TextENG: When I approached the front door, the doorbell rang—ding-dong.

TextJPN: レナが呼んだ医者だ。
TextENG: It must have been the doctor Rena had called.

TextJPN: 患者自らが医者を迎えるというのも変な話だが@k……大石さんが駆けつけるまでの数十分間、いてくれるだけでこれほど心強いことはない。
TextENG: It was strange for a patient to welcome in the doctor who was making a house call.@k But it would be incredibly reassuring to have him here for the considerable time it would take Ooishi-san to get here.

TextJPN: そう安直に思い、無警戒に玄関を開けたことを…数瞬後に悔やむ。
TextENG: I carelessly opened the door with that simple assumption... and regretted it almost instantly.

TextJPN: 「あれ、元気そうだね。@k@vS01/03/120300196.倒れてたって言うから、様子見に来たんだけど？」
TextENG: ``Oh, you look just fine.@k@vS01/03/120300196. I heard you collapsed, so I came to check up on you.``

TextJPN: 「…な……なんで俺が倒れてたって知ってるんだよ」
TextENG: ``...H-How did you know I collapsed?``

TextJPN: 「レナが電話してきたから。@k@vS01/03/120300198.……他に理由が必要？」
TextENG: ``I heard from Rena over the phone.@k@vS01/03/120300198. Do I need any reason other than that?``

TextJPN: 医者に電話するならわかる。
TextENG: I understood why she would call a doctor.

TextJPN: だが……どうして魅音まで？！？！
TextENG: But... why Mion, too!?!?

TextJPN: 俺の背後の階段をレナが下りてきた。
TextENG: Rena was descending the stairs behind me.

TextJPN: 「レナ、圭ちゃん大丈夫そうだよ？@k@vS01/03/120300200.　ったく心配して損したー」
TextENG: ``Rena, doesn't Kei-chan look pretty all right?@k@vS01/03/120300200. Sheesh, you made me worry for nothing.``

TextJPN: 「そうだね。@k@vS01/02/120200473.レナも心配して損したかな？」
TextENG: ``That's true.@k@vS01/02/120200473. Maybe I worried for nothing, as well.``

TextJPN: 二人は勝手に笑い出す。
TextENG: They both began laughing.

TextJPN: …陽気に笑うように見えたが…やはりどこか影のあるような感じは拭えない…。
TextENG: ...It appeared to be cheerful laughter... but I couldn't shake the feeling that there was a darkness looming over them...

TextJPN: 「…うわ、何この下駄箱。@k@vS01/03/120300202.どーしちゃったの？」
TextENG: ``...Whoa, what's up with this shoe rack?@k@vS01/03/120300202. How did it get like this?``

TextJPN: 昨日からそのままになっている叩き割られた靴箱…。
TextENG: The shoe rack that I'd smashed to pieces had been like that since yesterday...

TextJPN: 「あ、……えっと。……転んでさ。@k@vS01/01/120100782.その拍子に持ってたバットで叩いちゃったんだよ」
TextENG: ``Ah... um... I fell, you see.@k@vS01/01/120100782. And the bat I was holding at the time slammed into it.``

TextJPN: 「持ち慣れないもん振り回してるから、こーゆうことになるんだよ」
TextENG: ``This is what happens when you swing around something you're not used to handling.``

TextJPN: ……心の中で余計なお世話だと言っておく。
TextENG: ...I kept the fact that it was none of her business to myself.

TextJPN: 「でもこれじゃ、おばさまたちが帰ってきたらびっくりしちゃうね」
TextENG: ``But leaving it like this will really startle your parents when they get home.``

TextJPN: 「……あとでレナが片付けておくね！」
TextENG: ``...I'll fix it up for you later!``

TextJPN: 「さー、ほら圭ちゃん。@k@vS01/03/120300205.重病人なんだからちゃんと寝てないとだめだよ。@k@vS01/03/120300206.さーさー、お布団に戻った戻った！」
TextENG: ``Now, come on, Kei-chan.@k@vS01/03/120300205. The terminally ill need their rest.@k@vS01/03/120300206. Come come, back in bed, back in bed!``

TextJPN: 二人に促され、階段を上らされる。
TextENG: Both of them urged me up the stairs.

TextJPN: ……大石さんに電話をかける隙は、ない。
TextENG: ...I had no chance to call Ooishi-san.

TextJPN: 俺は布団の中に押し込められてしまった。
TextENG: I was pushed into my bed.

TextJPN: 魅音は初めて入る俺の部屋を興味深そうに物色している。
TextENG: As it was the first time Mion had been in my room, she began searching around it intently.

TextJPN: あれやこれをいじっては、レナにたしなめられる…そんな光景だった。
TextENG: She fiddled around my room and was scolded by Rena... You can imagine how it went.

TextJPN: 部屋を物色されることは落ち着かないが、会話は至って平凡、微笑ましいものだ。
TextENG: It was uncomfortable having my room poked around, but the conversation was so benign that it was heartwarming.

TextJPN: そんな平凡な会話の中で、さも当り前のことのように魅音が言った。
TextENG: During that innocent conversation, Mion said something as though it was perfectly ordinary.
``...Rena.@k@vS01/03/120300208. Did you call the Director?``

TextJPN: 「うん。@k@vS01/02/120200477.魅ぃちゃんに電話した後、すぐにね。@k@vS01/02/120200478.…すぐ来るって言ってたよ」
TextENG: ``Yup.@k@vS01/02/120200477. Right after I called Mii-chan.@k@vS01/02/120200478. He said he'd be right over.``

TextJPN: 監督？
TextENG: Director?

TextJPN: 場違いな単語に違和感を覚えた。
TextENG: That out-of-place word gave me a bad feeling.

TextJPN: レナは医者を呼ぶために電話をし、@k魅音を呼ぶために電話をし、@kそして…監督に電話をした？？
TextENG: Rena called a doctor...@k Then called Mion...@k and after that... she called a ``director``?

TextJPN: ……監督って、誰だよ。
TextENG: ...Who was this director?

TextJPN: レナと魅音の会話があまりにも安穏としているので、その違和感は些細だ。
TextENG: Since Rena and Mion's conversation was so peaceful, it only felt slightly odd.

TextJPN: 「……二人とも何の話をしてるんだよ？@k@vS01/01/120100784.　監督ってなんだよ」
TextENG: ``...What are you two talking about?@k@vS01/01/120100784. Who's this 'director'?``

TextJPN: 「あははは、圭ちゃん知んないの？@k@vS01/03/120300210.　監督ってったら監督だよ」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha, didn't you know, Kei-chan?@k@vS01/03/120300210. We mean the Director when we say 'director.'``

TextJPN: 「映画の監督とか。@k@vS01/02/120200480.工事現場の監督とか。あははははははははははははははははは」
TextENG: ``Like the director of a movie...@k@vS01/02/120200480. Or, like a foreman of a construction site. Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha.``

TextJPN: 俺に関係のある監督という単語を全記憶の中から洗い出す。
TextENG: I dug through all of my memories for a 'director' who might have business with me.

TextJPN: ……該当は一件しかない。
TextENG: ...Only one thing came to mind.

TextJPN: …それはレナが最後に言った、@k工事現場の監督。
TextENG: What Rena had just said...@k The construction site foreman.

TextJPN: 一番最初の殺人事件で被害者になった、ダム工事の…現場監督？
TextENG: The very first victim of the first incident, the dismemberment at the dam construction site... the foreman?

TextJPN: でもおかしい。
TextENG: But that was strange.

TextJPN: その監督は死んだはずだ。
TextENG: He was supposed to be dead.

TextJPN: 電話などできるはずもない。
TextENG: There was no way they could call him.

TextJPN: 「…お前らが何の話をしてるのかわからないよ。@k@vS01/01/120100786.……その監督が俺と何か関係あるのか？」
TextENG: ``... I don't understand what you guys are talking about.@k@vS01/01/120100786. What does that director have to do with me?``

TextJPN: 「……来るって言ったけど…うちに来るのか？」
TextENG: ``...You said he was coming... did you mean to my house?``

TextJPN: 当り前な疑問を次々とぶつける。
TextENG: I asked one obvious question after another.

TextJPN: だが…二人は至って涼しげに笑い合うだけだ。
TextENG: But... all the two of them did was smile coolly at each other.

TextJPN: そんな二人の様子と、怪訝に思う俺の温度差には明らかに開きがあった。
TextENG: There was a huge difference between how the two of them appeared and how my suspicions were playing out.

TextJPN: …徐々に、不愉快さと焦りが湧き上がってくる…。
TextENG: ...Slowly... I felt discomfort and panic welling up inside me...

TextJPN: ……レナと魅音が、何を言っているのか理解できない。
TextENG: ...I couldn't understand what Rena and Mion were talking about.

TextJPN: 「…圭ちゃん、最近は野球に凝ってるんだよね？@k@vS01/03/120300212.　監督、それ聞いたら喜ぶと思うなぁ」
TextENG: ``...Kei-chan, you've gotten into baseball lately, haven't you?@k@vS01/03/120300212. Pretty sure the Director will be happy to hear that.``

TextJPN: 「……だから監督って誰だよ」
TextENG: ``...So who is this Director?``

TextJPN: 「あはははは。監督は監督さんだよ。あははははははははははははははははは」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha. The Director is the director. Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha.``

TextJPN: 「…だから、監督って誰だよッ？！」
TextENG: ``...So who is this Director!?``

TextJPN: 「「あはははははははははははははははははははははははははははははははは…」」
TextENG: ````Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha...````

TextJPN: レナと魅音は二人してかおを見合わせると…けたけたと笑い出す。
TextENG: Rena and Mion looked at each other... and laughed haughtily.

TextJPN: それはこの上なく不快な…嫌な笑いの合唱だった。
TextENG: That disturbing cackle unpleasantly resounded around me.

TextJPN: 「「あははははははははははははははははははははははは」」
TextENG: ````Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha.````

TextJPN: 気味が悪いくらいに長かった笑いは、その長さとは逆に、あっさりと途切れた。
TextENG: That laugh, long enough to be unsettling, ended abruptly.

TextJPN: 「そうだ。@k@vS01/03/120300216.監督が来る前に済ませとくかな。@k@vS01/03/120300217_1.……圭ちゃん、覚えてるかい？」
TextENG: ``Oh, yeah.@k@vS01/03/120300216. We should finish up before the director comes...@k@vS01/03/120300217_1. You remember, don't you, Kei-chan?``

TextJPN: 顔は笑っているのに、…魅音の瞳からいつの間にか笑いが消えていた。
TextENG: Her face was laughing... but Mion's eyes told a different story.

TextJPN: 「……覚えてるって、…何をだよ」
TextENG: ``...Remember... remember what?``

TextJPN: 「あはははははははははははははは。圭一くん、忘れちゃったのかな？@k@vS01/02/120200485.　罰ゲームなんだよ。@k@vS01/02/120200486.罰ゲームなんだよ！」
TextENG: ``Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha. Keiichi-kun, had he forgotten, I wonder?@k@vS01/02/120200485. About the penalty.@k@vS01/02/120200486. About the penalty!``

TextJPN: 「…忘れちゃったのかなぁ？@k@vS01/02/120200488.　……おはぎの宿題。@k@vS01/02/120200489.どれがレナの作ったおはぎかを当てる宿題。@k@vS01/02/120200490.……あれ、確か宿題忘れだったよねぇ？」
TextENG: ``...Did you really forget?@k@vS01/02/120200488. ...The homework with the mochi?@k@vS01/02/120200489. The 'homework' where you were supposed to guess which one Rena made?@k@vS01/02/120200490. ...You forgot about that homework, didn't you?``

TextJPN: そんな宿題も確かあった。
TextENG: I certainly did have that 'homework.'

TextJPN: でも裁縫針が出てきたので残りのおはぎは全部投げてしまった。
TextENG: But I had thrown away the rest of the mochi after I found that sewing needle.

TextJPN: だからどれがレナの作ったものかは解答していない…。
TextENG: So I wasn't able to answer which one Rena made...

TextJPN: それの…罰ゲームだって…？
TextENG: The penalty... for that...?

TextJPN: なぜ今？！
TextENG: Why now!?

TextJPN: 「「あははははははははははははははははははははははははははは」」
TextENG: ````Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha.````

TextJPN: 俺の疑問は表情に出ていたに違いない。
TextENG: No doubt my question was written all over my face.

TextJPN: その疑問に対する答えが、二人のこの乾いた笑いだった。
TextENG: Their answer to my question was that dry laughter.

TextJPN: 何が何やら……わからなくなってくる。
TextENG: I could no longer make heads or tails of anything.

TextJPN: 今日一日…、思えば初めから…何かが狂っている。
TextENG: I began to think that this entire day... was somehow insane.

TextJPN: おかしい。
TextENG: Strange.

TextJPN: 理解できない。
TextENG: Incomprehensible.

TextJPN: レナに追われ、@k怪しい男たちに襲われ、@k魅音とレナがやってきて罰ゲーム。
TextENG: Being chased by Rena...@k Attacked by strange men...@k The penalty Mion and Rena were talking about.

TextJPN: 「「あははははははははははははははははははははははははははは」」
TextENG: ````Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha.````

TextJPN: こいつらは…何が可笑しいんだ……？！
TextENG: What... were these two laughing at...!?

TextJPN: すでに異常な空間に引きずりこまれていることを気付くのに、そんなに時間はかからなかった。
TextENG: It didn't take that long for me to realize I had been dragged into an abnormal situation.

TextJPN: ……こいつらは…一体誰なんだ？！
TextENG: ...Who were... these two!?

TextJPN: レナや魅音によく似た……誰なんだッ？！？！
TextENG: Who were these people...? Who were these doppelgangers of Rena and Mion!?!?

TextJPN: いつの間にかレナが俺の後ろにいた。
TextENG: Rena had gotten behind me at some point.

TextJPN: なぜと思う間もなく、後ろから羽交い絞めにされる！！
TextENG: Why was she pinning my arms behind my back!?

TextJPN: 「な、何の真似だよッ？！？！」
TextENG: ``Wh-What are you doing!?``

TextJPN: 「動かないでね。@k@vS01/02/120200494.罰ゲームだから。@k@vS01/02/120200495.あはははははははははははははははは」
TextENG: ``Don't move.@k@vS01/02/120200494. This is your penalty.@k@vS01/02/120200495. Ahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha.``

TextJPN: 自分の体が鈍重とは言え…、レナの羽交い絞めはがっちりと極まり身動きができない。
TextENG: My body was already very sluggish... and Rena pinning my arms made it that much harder to move.

TextJPN: あまりの力強さに…俺もほんのちょっと本気になって抵抗したが…それでもびくともしないのだ。
TextENG: I seriously tried to struggle, but she wouldn't even budge.

TextJPN: 焦りが噴出し、冗談の領域を超えたことを悟る。
TextENG: My panic began to well up, and I realized this was well beyond the realm of jokes and pleasantries.

TextJPN: こんな尋常でない万力のような力を…俺のよく知っているレナが出せるわけがない…！
TextENG: This freakishly monstrous strength... it would have been impossible for the Rena that I knew...!

TextJPN: じゃあ…俺をがっちりと締め上げているこの細くて華奢そうな腕は…誰の腕なんだよ？！？！
TextENG: Then... these thin, frail arms grasping me firmly... whose arms were they!?!?

TextJPN: 「……圭ちゃん、抵抗しちゃだめだよ～。@k@vS01/03/120300221.会則第……何条でもいいや。@k@vS01/03/120300222.罰ゲームに抵抗しちゃだめなんだからさ～！」
TextENG: ``...Kei-chan, no struggling~@k@vS01/03/120300221. Club rule number... ah, it doesn't matter which one.@k@vS01/03/120300222. You can't fight against the penalty~!``

TextJPN: 魅音、いや、魅音によく似たそいつは、まるで魅音のように、俺に語りかける。
TextENG: Mion... no, that thing that looked like Mion... spoke to me like how Mion would speak to me.

TextJPN: だが…間違いなく、魅音じゃない。
TextENG: But... I was certain... that this was not Mion.

TextJPN: ……魅音じゃない何者かが…魅音のフリをしているッ！！！
TextENG: ...Someone who wasn't Mion... someone who was just pretending to be Mion!!!

TextJPN: 「くっくっく…。@k@vS01/03/120300224.監督が来る前に済まさないとねぇ」
TextENG: ``Heheheh...@k@vS01/03/120300224. Need to finish this up before the director comes.``

TextJPN: 魅音がポケットをまさぐると…そこから奇妙な物を取り出した。
TextENG: Mion fished into her pockets and pulled out something bizarre.

TextJPN: ……それが何か、視覚的には理解できたが、なぜ魅音のポケットから出てくるのかを…常識的に理解できなかった。
TextENG: ...I could tell what it was just by looking, but for such a thing to be in her pocket... my mind wouldn't accept it.

TextJPN: 「……なんだよ………それ……」
それは……小さな…注射器だった。
TextENG: It was... a small... syringe...

TextJPN: 子供の頃、高熱を出して医者に行くと…必ず射たれた……あの小さな透明の注射器…。
TextENG: It was a small, clear syringe, the kind a doctor might use if you went to them with a high fever...

TextJPN: レナはさらに俺を強く押さえつける。
TextENG: Rena held me even tighter.

TextJPN: そして耳元で、げてげてげて、ともはや笑い声にも聞こえないような声で大笑いした。
TextENG: And I could hear that clattering laughter that no longer sounded like laughter blaring into my ear.

TextJPN: その奇怪な笑い声は…絶対に、俺の知っているレナの喉から出せるものではない。
TextENG: That eerie laughter... It wasn't something that the Rena I knew could ever produce from her own throat.

TextJPN: …レナのふりをする…こいつの本当の笑い声なのだ…？！
TextENG: ...This thing that was pretending to be Rena... was this their real laugh...!?

TextJPN: 抵抗することもできない俺に…魅音が注射器を構えながら…迫ってくる！！
TextENG: Unable to defend myself... the syringe Mion was holding... drew closer!!

TextJPN: そしてその針先を、俺の目の前で何度もちらつかせた。
TextENG: And that needle tip was waved in front of my face countless times.

TextJPN: 「大丈夫大丈夫。@k@vS01/03/120300226.痛くないから痛くないから…。@k@vS01/03/120300227.くっくっくっく…！！」
TextENG: ``Don't worry, don't worry.@k@vS01/03/120300226. It won't hurt, it won't hurt...@k@vS01/03/120300227. heheheheh...!!``

TextJPN: 「な……何をする気だよ……。@k@vS01/01/120100794.これは一体何の真似だよッ？！？！」
TextENG: ``Wh... What are you planning on doing...?@k@vS01/01/120100794. What kind of sick joke is this!?!?``

TextJPN: 「…圭ちゃん、何言ってんだか。@k@vS01/03/120300229.……わかってんでしょ？」
TextENG: ``...What are you saying, Kei-chan?@k@vS01/03/120300229. ...You know exactly what's going on, don't you?``

TextJPN: 「何が！@k@vS01/01/120100796.　俺には何が何やらさっぱりわからねえよ…！！」
TextENG: ``About what!?@k@vS01/01/120100796. I don't understand any of this at all...!!``

TextJPN: 「……知ってるくせにー。@k@vS01/03/120300231.今さらカマトトぶられてもなぁ」
TextENG: ``...I know you know.@k@vS01/03/120300231. No use playing the fool this late in the game.``

TextJPN: 「わけのわからないことを言って俺を煙に巻くのはやめろッ！！！」
TextENG: ``Stop talking nonsense to try and confuse me!!!``

TextJPN: 「………富竹さんと同じ目に遭ってもらう」
TextENG: ``...You're going to have done to you what happened to Tomitake-san.``

TextJPN: 富竹さんと…同じ目…？！
TextENG: The same as... Tomitake-san...!?

TextJPN: よく意味がわからない。
TextENG: I didn't really understand what she meant.

TextJPN: それとこの注射器に…どんな関係があるんだ…？！
TextENG: What did that have to do... with this syringe...!?

TextJPN: 「……圭一くん、とぼけてるね。@k@vS01/02/120200497.薄々は気付いてたくせにぃ☆」
TextENG: ``...You're playing dumb, Keiichi-kun.@k@vS01/02/120200497. You should have realized it by now.``

TextJPN: レナが耳元に口を寄せて、諭すように笑いかける。
TextENG: Rena whispered into my ear, laughing as if to admonish me.

TextJPN: ……だがその口調にも、喩えようもないおぞましさが含まれていた。
TextENG: ...But even the way she spoke was repulsive beyond compare.

TextJPN: とぼけてるって？
TextENG: Playing dumb?

TextJPN: 俺が？@k　何を！！
TextENG: Me?@k About what!?

TextJPN: 富竹さんと同じ目…だって？！
TextENG: What do you mean... the same as Tomitake-san!?

TextJPN: 「みんな初めは轢き逃げされたものだと思っていました。@k@vS01/11/120700040.ですが、意識を確かめるために近付いた警官はすぐに異常に気付きました。@k@vS01/11/120700041.…喉がね、引き裂かれていたんですよ」
TextENG: ``Everyone thought at first that it was a hit and run.@k@vS01/11/120700040. Except when the officer got closer to check if he was still alive, he soon noticed it wasn't a normal situation.@k@vS01/11/120700041. ...His throat was scratched out.``

TextJPN: 「ナ、…ナイフとか……？！」
TextENG: ``F-From a knife or something...!?``
Nails!?

TextJPN: 爪って、指についてる…この爪か？！
TextENG: Nails as in fingernails!?

TextJPN: それで…ガリガリと？！？！
TextENG: With those... Gouged through!?

TextJPN: そうだ。
TextENG: That's right.

TextJPN: ……富竹さんは…自らの爪で喉を引き裂いての絶命だった。
TextENG: ...Tomitake-san... had clawed out his own throat with his own nails and died.

TextJPN: そんな死に方あるわけがない！！
TextENG: There's no way someone could die like that!!

TextJPN: もしも考えられるとしたら……！！！
TextENG: So then, for that to happen...!!!

TextJPN: 「薬物を疑いましたが、そういう類のものは検出できませんでした」
TextENG: ``We thought drugs were to blame, but nothing of that nature was detected.``

TextJPN: そうだよ。
TextENG: That's right.

TextJPN: 警察は富竹さんの遺体からは薬物は検出できなかったはず………！
TextENG: The police didn't find any drugs in Tomitake-san's system.

TextJPN: 「け、警察は……富竹さんの遺体からは…薬物は検出できなかったって言ったぞ？！」
TextENG: ``Th-The police told me... they didn't find any drugs... in Tomitake-san's body!``

TextJPN: げてげてげてげてげてげて…！！！！！
TextENG: Gweh gweh gweh gweh gweh gweh gweh...!!!!!

TextJPN: 二人は笑い声ともつかない、奇怪な声で笑い合う。
TextENG: The two of them laughed together with that sickening laughter.

TextJPN: 笑うのは当然だ。
TextENG: Of course they'd laugh.

TextJPN: ……警察にわからなかったから、そんな薬物は存在しないなんて決め付けが…いかに愚かしいことか…！
TextENG: ...To assume that such a medicine didn't exist just because the police didn't know about it... was completely foolish...!

TextJPN: つまり……富竹さんにあんな異常な死に方を遂げさせる薬物は…実在するのか？！
TextENG: Meaning... The drug that caused Tomitake-san to die in such a bizarre manner... did exist!?

TextJPN: このまま魅音に、それを注射されれば否応なくそれを実証することになるだろう…。
TextENG: If Mion injected this into me, then that would probably be all the proof I needed...

TextJPN: それはつまり…富竹さんと同じ末路。
TextENG: That would basically mean I'd end up the same as Tomitake-san.

TextJPN: ……錯乱し、最期には自ら喉を引き裂いて…死！
TextENG: ...Become hysterical, scratching out my throat in my last moments... then die!

TextJPN: こんな奇怪な薬物が実在すること、@kそしてそれを魅音たちが所持していること、@kそしてそれが自分に注射されようとしていること。
TextENG: For such an outrageous drug to exist...@k For Mion to be holding it...@k And that I was about to be injected with it...

TextJPN: ……今この瞬間、それらを疑問に思う必要は、一切ない。
TextENG: ...At that moment, I did not feel there was any need whatsoever to question it.

TextJPN: 自分の顔面目がけて飛んでくるボールをかわす時、飛んできた理由を考える阿呆がどこにいる？
TextENG: What kind of idiot, when he's trying to dodge a ball flying straight for his face, has time to think of a reason as to why it's flying at him?

TextJPN: 「……観念しなって。んじゃ、」
TextENG: ``...Just give up. Alright then.``

TextJPN: 魅音の仕草があまりにも呆気なくて、それが恐ろしかった。
TextENG: Mion's actions lacked any gravitas, and that made it even more terrifying.

TextJPN: 死刑を執行する時の厳かさなどない。
TextENG: There was none of the ceremony like when someone is sentenced to death.

TextJPN: …まるで日常風景のありふれた行為であるかのように、躊躇がなかったからだ。
TextENG: ...There was no hesitation at all, as if she were brushing her teeth.

TextJPN: 魅音がもう片方の手を伸ばし、俺の胸元を掴んだ瞬間ッ！！！！
TextENG: Mion reached out with one hand and grabbed onto my chest...!!!!

TextJPN: 後頭部に電気が走り、世界中が停電になったような錯覚を感じた。
TextENG: It felt like electricity had run through the back of my head and the entire world had gone dark.

TextJPN: 立ちくらみ？
TextENG: Did I stand up too fast?

TextJPN: それとも…誰かに後頭部を思い切り殴られた？
TextENG: Or... did someone hit me really hard in the back of the head?

TextJPN: 平衡感覚が失われ、めまいに襲われる……。
TextENG: Having lost my sense of balance, I was assaulted by a wave of dizziness.
